DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the number of medical devices in a base package.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Medical device - any machinery designed to aid diagnostic and medical therapies. Medical device has to be designed with rigorous safety standards. There are several basic types of medical devices: life support equipment used to maintain a patient's body functions; therapeutic equipment; monitors and detectors to measure the indexes of a patient's state; imagine machines and laboratory equipment used with diagnostic and status monitoring purposes. In insurance parlance, the term is usually synonymous with assistive device, although it may include medical supplies.

Concepts.definition: Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Quantity; how much there is of something that you can measure.

Concepts.definition: How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

DataElementConcept.origin: FDA: FDA GUDID (Global Unique Device Identification Database)
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released during the November 2018 Draft New Cleanup_11.07.18

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Medical device - any machinery designed to aid diagnostic and medical therapies. Medical device has to be designed with rigorous safety standards. There are several basic types of medical devices: life support equipment used to maintain a patient's body functions; therapeutic equipment; monitors and detectors to measure the indexes of a patient's state; imagine machines and laboratory equipment used with diagnostic and status monitoring purposes. In insurance parlance, the term is usually synonymous with assistive device, although it may include medical supplies._To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.: (KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.
(KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.: (KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.

Concepts.definition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.
(KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.: (KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.
(KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.: (KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
(KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.
